item.title: Moushumi add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by Salvador Dali
item.description: "I don't do drugs. I am drugs." -- Salvador Dali

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "Youth is happy because it has the capacity to see beauty. Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "It was a bright cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen." -- George Orwell

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you want your children to be intelligent, read them fairy tales. If you want them to be more intelligent, read them more fairy tales." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by H.L. Mencken
item.description: "The older I grow, the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age brings wisdom." -- H.L. Mencken

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "It is never too late to be what you might have been." -- George Eliot

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "Grammar is a piano I play by ear." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Much unhappiness has come into the world because of bewilderment and things left unsaid." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Nobody likes being alone that much. I don't go out of my way to make friends, that's all. It just leads to disappointment. " -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by David Hockney
item.description: "I think I’m greedy, but I’m not greedy for money - I think that can be a burden - I’m greedy for an exciting life." -- David Hockney

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by Orhan Pamuk
item.description: "Tell me then, does love make one a fool or do only fools fall in love?" -- Orhan Pamuk

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I like to have a martini, Two at the very most. After three I'm under the table, after four I'm under my host." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "It's like Tolstoy said. Happiness is an allegory, unhappiness a <i>story</i>." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by Edgar Lee Masters
item.description: "To this generation I would say: Memorize some bit of verse of truth or beauty." -- Edgar Lee Masters

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by Jane Smiley
item.description: "Many people, myself among them, feel better at the mere sight of a book." -- Jane Smiley

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I hope that in this year to come, you make mistakes. Because if you are making mistakes...you're Doing Something." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by John Muir
item.description: "The clearest way into the Universe is through a forest wilderness." -- John Muir

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by Banksy
item.description: "The greatest crimes in the world are not committed by people breaking the rules but by people following the rules. It's people who follow orders that drop bombs and massacre villages." -- Banksy

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by Banksy
item.description: "Nothing in the world is more common than unsuccessful people with talent, leave the house before you find something worth staying in for. " -- Banksy

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by E.L. Konigsburg
item.description: "Happiness is excitement that has found a settling down place, but there is always a little corner that keeps flapping around." -- E.L. Konigsburg

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by E.L. Konigsburg
item.description: "I think you should learn, of course, and some days you must learn a great deal. But you should also have days when you allow what is already in you to swell up inside of you until it touches everything. And you can feel it inside of you. If you never take time out to let that happen, then you accumulate facts, and they begin to rattle around inside of you. You can make noise with them, but never really feel anything with them. It's hollow." -- E.L. Konigsburg

item.title: Moushumi add a quote by Wisława Szymborska
item.description: "I prefer the absurdity of writing poems to the absurdity of not writing poems." -- Wisława Szymborska
